properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This message is being issued for Nullawil.
  • There is a building fire on the Calder Highway in Nullawil.
  • Firefighters are currently responding to this fire. 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby roads and communities.
  • Drive with caution and allow extra time for travel in the area.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.   

Health information: 
  • If you need medical advice for exposure to smoke, seek medical advice or call Nurse on Call on 1300 606 024. 
  • Anyone experiencing wheezing, chest tightness and difficulty breathing should call Triple Zero (000).     
Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Castle Creek, Huon Creek, Indigo Valley
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Castle Creek, Huon Creek, Indigo Valley.

  • There is a grassfire at Spring Gully Road, Huon Creek that is under control.
  • This Advice message replaces the Advice message issued at 9:19pm. 
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and monitor conditions.

Impacts in your area: 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Please keep roads clear for emergency services.
  • Firefighters will be on scene today monitoring this fire. 
  • Aircraft will be in the area.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 01/03/2024 03:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information is being issued for Katamatite, Katamatite East .

  • There is a haystack fire at Barnes Rd, Katamatite. 
  • Haystack fires are not likely to spread into grassland but do generate a lot of smoke.
  • This fire may continue to burn for up to 4 days.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby roads and communities.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 

  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to cal VicEmergency
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Amphitheatre, Avoca, Bayindeen, Beaufort, Ben Nevis, Buangor East, Chute, Elmhurst, Eurambeen, Eversley, Glenlogie, Glenpatrick, Green Hill Creek, Langi Kal Kal, Lexton, Main Lead, Mount Cole, Mount Lonarch, Nowhere Creek, Raglan, Rosyth, Trawalla, Waterloo, Glenshee, Brewster, Buangor, Ercildoune, Glenbrae, Glenlofty, Lamplough, Middle Creek, Mount Cole Creek, Percydale, Warrak, Warrenmang
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Amphitheatre, Avoca, Bayindeen, Beaufort, Ben Nevis, Brewster, Buangor, Buangor East, Chute, Elmhurst, Ercildoune, Eurambeen, Eversley, Glenbrae, Glenlofty, Glenlogie, Glenpatrick, Green Hill Creek, Lamplough, Langi Kal Kal, Lexton, Main Lead, Middle Creek, Mount Cole, Mount Cole Creek, Mount Lonarch, Nowhere Creek, Percydale, Raglan, Rosyth, Trawalla, Warrak, Warrenmang, Waterloo, Glenshee. 

  • It is Safe to Return for people who left due to the bushfire at Bayindeen-Rocky-Road.  
  • The fire is contained.  
  • There may still be some localised fire activity and smoke.
  • Aircraft, heavy machinery, and firefighters will still be active. 
  • This Advice message replaces all previous messages for the warning area.
The threat is reduced, and it is now safe for you to return to your home or business.
What you should do: 
  • Stay alert - be aware of hazards caused by the fire. 
  • Be aware of road hazards such as fallen trees and any road closures. 
  • Check your home or building for damage before you re-enter. 
  • If you have any questions about recovering from this fire, you should call the VicEmergency Hotline on free call 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief
  • For local fire recovery concerns, you should contact Pyrenees Shire on 1300 797 363 or visit Pyrenees Shire website. 
Impacts in your area:
  • Roads are opening in the area for residents to return.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures in your local area.
The following roads have traffic management points and residents will be required to show ID to access their properties.

  • Main Lead Road at King Street Beaufort 
  • Eurambeen -Raglan Road, Eurambeen from Western Highway to Raglan
  • Raglan-Elmhurst Road at the Pyrenees Highway
  • Raglan-Elmhurst Road at Eurambeen -Raglan Road
  • Amphitheatre Road at Chute-Waterloo Road toward Raglan

All Relief Centres closed as of 8.30pm, Thursday February 29.


Community Meetings

Friday March 1
Elmhurst Community Centre, High street Elmhurst-11am
This meeting will also be live-streamed on the Ararat Rural City Council Facebook page.https://www.facebook.com/AraratRuralCityCouncil 

Beaufort Shire Hall,  Lawrence street Beaufort-3pm
The meeting will also be live-streamed on the Pyrenees Shire Council Facebook page.https://www.facebook.com/pyreneessc 

Lexton residents are asked to attend either the Elmhurst or Beaufort meeting or click on one of the links above to watch via live-streaming. 


Air Quality

EPA have put air quality monitors at Amphitheatre and Beaufort.

Check EPA website for current readings and advice.


Beaufort Urgent Care Centre         

The Beaufort Urgent Care Centre at 28 Havelock Street Beaufort is now open and back to full services.

  

The following public land areas have been affected by the Bayindeen-Rocky Road Fire:

State Forest closures:
  • Mount Cole State Forest
  • Ben Major State Forest
  • Mt Lonarch State Forest 
  • Musical Gully State Forest 
  • Camphill State Forest
Parks Victoria closure:
  • Mount Buangor State Park 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.  

This will be the final message issued for this incident. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:

This Advice message   is being issued for Amphitheatre, Avoca, Bayindeen, Beaufort, Ben Nevis, Brewster, Buangor, Buangor East, Chute, Elmhurst, Ercildoune, Eurambeen, Eversley, Glenbrae, Glenlofty, Glenlogie, Glenpatrick, Green Hill Creek, Lamplough, Langi Kal Kal, Lexton, Main Lead, Middle Creek, Mount Cole, Mount Cole Creek, Mount Lonarch, Nowhere Creek, Percydale, Raglan, Rosyth, Trawalla, Warrak, Warrenmang, Waterloo, Glenshee. 

- It is Safe to Return for people who left due to the bushfire at Bayindeen-Rocky-Road.

The threat is reduced, and it is now safe for you to return to your home or business.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This message is being issued for water quality at Lake Bolac. 
  • High levels of blue-green algae have been detected in the lake. 
  • The algal bloom is expected to remain until there is significant rainfall to flush the lake or cooler conditions slow the algae. 
  • Regular testing is being conducted to identify new outbreaks or changes that might indicate improved water quality. 
  • This notification will be reviewed weekly and updated as the situation changes.
Warning signs have been installed at the lake.

You should avoid direct contact with affected water in Lake Bolac.

Do not swim in affected areas or use water for cooking, drinking, washing or showering. Boiling the water will not make it safe. 
What you should do:
  • Visit Parks Victoria website (https://www.parks.vic.gov.au/places-to-see/parks/lake-bolac-highway-park) for more information. 
  • Observe information signs posted at the lake.
Protect your health:
  • Direct contact with water affected by blue green algae can cause skin irritation, sore eyes, ears and nose. If swallowed it can cause cramps, nausea and vomiting. 
  • If you do come into contact with affected water, wash your skin immediately in clean cool water. 
  • Boiling affected water does not make it safe to drink. Boiling water bursts the blue green algae cells and releases toxins into the water making it more likely that you will experience symptoms. 
  • If you are experiencing any health issues after contact with affected water seek medical advice from your local doctor or Nurse-On-Call on 1300 60 60 24.
Protect your pets:
  • Pet owners should prevent pets from drinking or having direct contact with contaminated water. 
Agriculture information: 
  • Irrigation water contaminated with blue-green algae should not be spray irrigated on vegetables and fruit, or come in contact with plants being grown for food during processing and packing. 
  • Fruit and vegetables grown in the affected areas are safe to consume if farmers follow recommendations regarding blue-green algae
Impacts in your area:
  • The water is  green as a result of the algae bloom.
Boating and fishing:
  • Boating and fishing is still allowed in these areas, however care needs to be taken.
  • Fish caught from affected areas should be rinsed and cleaned thoroughly in fresh water, and internal organs removed from the fish and discarded before eating. 
  • Do not eat mussels, crayfish or yabbies caught from the affected area. 
This message was issued by Department of Energy, Environment and Climate Action.

The next update is expected by 31/03/2024 05:20 pm or as the situation changes.

Information about blue green algae:
  • For information on blue green algae visit: www2.health.vic.gov.au/public-health/water/blue-green-algae-cyanobac teria.
Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter.
  • Tune into ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
COMMUNITY INFORMATION - BLUE GREEN ALGAE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: Lake Bolac
Issue Date: Tuesday 23 January 2024, 03:14 pm
Next Update: Sunday 31 March 2024, 05:20 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/32563/moreinfo

This message is being issued for water quality at Lake Bolac. 
- High levels of blue-green algae have been detected in the lake. 
- The algal bloom is expected to remain until there is significant rainfall to flush the lake or cooler conditions slow the algae. 
- Regular testing is being conducted to identify new outbreaks or changes that might indicate improved water quality. 
- This notification will be reviewed weekly and updated as the situation changes. 



Warning signs have been installed at the lake. 
You should avoid direct contact with affected water in Lake Bolac.

Do not swim in affected areas or use water for cooking, drinking, washing or showering. Boiling the water will not make it safe.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Dereel.

  • There was a grassfire that started at Kleins Rd, Dereel that is under control.
  • Fire crews will be undertaking fuel reduction activities today to further contain the fire.
  • You may see increased levels of smoke over the coming hours as firefighters complete these necessary tasks.
  • This Advice message replaces the Advice issued at 11:11 am on Thursday 29 February 2024.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
  • Review your fire survival plan.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Colac-Ballarat Road has been reopened with reduced speed limits through the warning area.
  • Sections of Swamp Road remain closed due to hazardous trees.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.

This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 01/03/2024 03:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Pomonal and surrounding communities.  

  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park, Bellfield that is under control.
  • Fire crews remain in the area monitoring conditions.
  • Areas of the Grampians National Park near the Bellfield fire remain closed.  Check parks.vic.gov.au for more information.
  • Access to Pomonal is restricted to local residents, emergency services and essential services. Check the VicTraffic website (VicTraffic) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required. 
Continue to monitor conditions. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 01/03/2024 08:20 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:

  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Lakes Entrance beach.

  • Due to a whale carcass, there could be an increase in shark activity.
  • The whale carcass is located at the east of Drew's Jetty. 
  • A whale carcass can attract sharks to the area and mean they are closer to the shore than normal.
  • While it is not uncommon for sharks to be present off the Victorian coast, you should exercise additional caution in the area.
  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued on 22 February. 
Avoid the area. Stay informed and do not enter the water at closed beaches.
What you should do:

  • If you see sharks, report the sighting by calling Triple Zero (000) or notify lifesavers immediately if you are at a patrolled beach.
Staying safe at nearby beaches:
  • Always swim, dive or surf with a friend.
  • Swim between the red and yellow flags on patrolled beaches.
  • Don't swim in places where human or animal waste enters the water.
  • Keep away from large schools of fish, seals or other wildlife as these can attract sharks.
Impacts in your area:
  • The Victorian Fisheries Authority is monitoring for shark sightings and providing advice to relevant authorities. 
This message was issued by VFA.

The next update is expected by 07/03/2024 03:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.   
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
